jobs.description:
ABOUT THE ROLE

As a Front-End Software Engineer, you will be building a world-class interface for an industry that up until now has been underserved, with online solutions that have not evolved much since 1999. This role is an exceptional opportunity to create impactful features & functionality for users who are hungry for modern solutions in their day to day workflow! Our current website runs on Flask, Jinja, Less, Angular, Node, Python and more, but we are strong believers in using the right tool for the right job. 

As a Front End Engineer you will be responsible for:
• Creating, testing, releasing and managing high performance UI components
• Identifying and addressing performance bottlenecks across all browsers
• Collaborating with other engineers to bring new concepts into the browser

ABOUT YOU

You are interested in every step of the user experience on the client side. From load times, to beautiful design, to intuitive UI, to understanding what usage statistics mean this is your domain and your medium. You are someone who enjoys tinkering, and has a passion for continuously evolving your process and tooling. You love javascript and have a genuine enthusiasm for working with the Angular framework, even if you have not shipped a project with it yet. In addition to expert-level coding skills you see yourself as a creative and love to develop and understand design concepts.

Possessing the following will help you to be successful in this role:
• 5+ years Front End Engineering experience (from within a data driven B2C platform is advantageous)
• Expert knowledge of JavaScript, HTML and CSS
• Solid experience working within an Agile development environment
• Experience building & releasing modern cross-browser web applications
• Proficient with, but not reliant upon, object-oriented JavaScript Frameworks

startup.product_desc:

Starting with our assessment, users answer a short series of questions, from which Lantern is able to understand your areas of strength and opportunities for improvement within your emotional well-being, and then create a custom program tailored your needs.   All users are connected to a licensed professional who offers you support, weekly feedback, and answers any questions you have via in-app text and phone support.  

Lantern's programs are being used by thousands of individuals, have partnerships with 30+ colleges/universities across the country, won the grand prize at SXSW Accelerator in 2014, and are venture backed.

We are looking for someone that can hit the ground sprinting and start pushing features live on day one. Since we have a small team, you’ll need to be someone that can be self-directed and help set the schedule of what needs to be done… and then go do it.   As an early hire, you will share responsibility for laying the technical foundations necessary to support a product that is engaging enough to break the common misconception that technology is too impersonal to be useful in mental health.

While building functional products is a top priority of the engineering team at Lantern, we also acknowledge the importance of intentionally building a culture that supports the broader company mission.  As cliche as it sounds, we all decided to work here because we wanted to help make the world at least a little better than the way we found it.  The engineering team at Lantern strives to mirror this sentiment in ourselves by fostering an environment of mutual respect, open communication, curiosity, humor and general tomfoolery.  If these qualities sound great to you, you’ll fit in quite swingingly.

The website and iPhone app helps drive new and existing customers to businesses when they need them most, before the time passes and the appointment goes unfilled. MyTime is available through both the website (http://www.mytime.com) and iPhone app (download at http://www.mytime.com/iphone). The iPhone app launched on October 3, 2013. Upon launch, the MyTime app was featured by Apple under Best New Apps, and it's ranked #1 in the Lifestyle category.

MyTime is reinventing local ecommerce. We’ve built an online destination where consumers can book appointments and purchase local services such as haircuts, house cleanings, massages, and more from nearby local businesses. MyTime has integrated into the leading calendar applications on the market, giving us real-time visibility into each merchant’s schedule. When customers book appointments on MyTime, we even write back to the merchant’s calendar. This allows us to be a true one-stop destination to purchase services from millions of businesses across the country.

The Job.
You will work closely with a talented team of designers and engineers who design, implement and ship features from scratch. You will convert wireframes and high fidelity mocks into elegant and readable code. You will be ready to continuously iterate on features based on feedback from our complex analytics tools as well as user feedback. You will make use of industry best practices and and cutting edge frontend frameworks (we use backbone and angularjs with bootstrap) to build a very polished user experience for both the web, as well as mobile web. You will help with performing user testing, A/B testing and working closely with out design and analytics teams to this end.

Bring It.
A stickler for perfection who really cares about the details that make UI extraordinary
Proficient in web technologies: HTML, CSS, Javascript
Demonstrate proficiency in design and UX sensibilities
Impressive portfolio of products you have shipped
Experience with mobile web a definite plus

Act now, and you’ll also get…:
Competitive salary. Significant equity. Opportunity to make a tremendous impact.
Full Benefits Package, Catered Meals, Awesome SOMA location.
The chance to actually make a difference in a growing startup that is solving a big problem.

You will be tasked with carrying projects from inception to MVP, market validation, and the subsequent growth stage. You will be working closely with an expert team of designers, software engineers, and strategy folks but will be given enough freedom to make your own mistakes - and breakthroughs. 

To succeed in this role, you should have a deep technology background as well as a native understanding of important business factors determining the impact of web- or mobile-driven products. You may have built your own startups or businesses in the past, bonus points for both success and failure! 

Fundamentally, this role is a barrel - quoting from Keith Rabois: "If you think about people, there are two categories of high-quality people: there is the ammunition, and then there are the barrels. You can add all the ammunition you want, but if you have only five barrels in your company, you can literally do only five things simultaneously [...] someone who can take an idea from conception to live and it’s almost perfect [...] This kind of person can pull people with them. They can charge up the hill. They can motivate their team, and they can edit themselves autonomously."

If that sounds like you: Apply!

startup.name: FastBar
startup.product_desc:
Everyone hates long bar lines. They suck for attendees and bars hate them as well because they harm their revenue and reputation.

FastBar solves this problem with a unique, cashless payment solution that’s quicker than anything else on the market. For example, completing a transaction with credit card typically takes 45+ seconds. Paying with FastBar takes less than 1 second.

When attendees arrive at an event, they get a wristband that's linked to their credit card. At the point of sale, they pay for drinks, food or merchandise by tapping their wristband on a reader. At the end of the night, we automatically close them out with the credit card on file and send them an email receipt. The payment experience is exactly like Uber.

Attendees get their drinks quicker, never wait in line to close out their tab and never leave their credit card behind. Bars improve revenue by 15-30%, reduce labor cost by 16% and gain unprecedented insight into their business.

jobs.description:
Are you a rock star technologist looking to join an early stage startup at the intersection of payments, events and wearable technology? Are you looking to get involved in a company where you can not only can dive deep and crank out code across a variety of technologies, but also build and lead a team of hardcore engineers as we scale? Do you have an interest in payment systems? If so, read on…

We’re FastBar, and we solve the problem of long bar lines at events through a unique, cashless payment solution that’s quicker than anything else on the market. The way it works is really simple: when you arrive at an event, you get a wristband that’s linked to your credit card. At the bar, you pay by tapping your wristband on a reader. At the end of the night, we automatically close you out with the credit card on file and send you an email receipt. The payment experience is exactly like Uber.

In just over 6 months since our inception, we’ve built a prototype, tested it at 15 live events for up to 650 people, completed the Startup Next Program, we were a finalist in the WTIA First Look Forum, won the “Best Idea Service/Retail” prize at the UW BPC and were accepted into and completed the 9Mile Labs accelerator program as part of their fall 2014 cohort (they invested in us).

FastBar sits at the intersection of payments, events and wearable technology with a unique solution to a real problem in a huge market.

This is a full-time co-founder level position, with the equity to match.

About you: a hardcore technologist with a track record of building great products and managing high performing teams; ready and able to join a startup; comfortable with many programming languages, full-stack dev; BSc Comp Sci or equivalent; committed, trustworthy, easy to work with; obsessed with high quality code, but understand the realities of startup engineering. Experience with hardware, NFC, iOS, Android, web etc....

If you think you’re a match, drop us a line, we’d love to chat further.

startup.product_desc:
Group conversations are a daily struggle for 400 million people suffering from disabling hearing loss, which excludes them from a lot of professional and social interactions.
Transcense is the easiest way to understand them. 

Like a Siri for group conversations, the mobile app empowers individuals to see who says what around them, in less than a second. Our system swiftly pairs smartphones in a room, and processes the conversation to show you a real time, color-coded transcript of the discussion. At business meetings, family dinners, social gatherings, you launch the app, and Transcense does the rest.

Transcense is transforming communications for the deaf/hard-of-hearing people by bridging communication gaps with a personal, lightning fast and affordable experience of captioning.
startup.high_concept: Empowering the hearing-impaired in group conversations.

startup.product_desc:
Choose Energy is an online marketplace where shopping for energy is fast and easy. Residents and businesses can compare rates, plan terms, and renewable options from a network of trusted partners in a secure, user-friendly experience. By providing actionable energy intelligence, Choose Energy helps its customers make smart, personalized energy decisions. The easiest analogy is as Kayak and Sabre are to travel, Choose Energy is to energy. 

Choose Energy was founded in 2008 by Jerry Dyess and funded in 2012 by Kleiner Perkins to scale and expand Jerry’s original energy-shopping ideas. Over the last 2 years, the team, primarily based in SF, has connected all of the major suppliers to enable shopping in deregulated states and built a platform to allow direct shopping on ChooseEnergy.com as well as third parties to leverage our platform. 

Headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Dallas and Chicago, Choose Energy is backed by Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers and industry leaders.

jobs.description:
Our content experience at ChooseEnergy.com provides resources to empower and educate people about choosing their own energy suppliers. Combined with our comparison shopping app, we help people save money and gain peace of mind around their energy bills.

As a PHP and WordPress developer on our content experience, you are responsible for the continued development and maintenance of our custom WordPress theme and plugins, optimizing our WP instances, and creating new content templates regularly in coordination with our Marketing team. Additionally, you work with other engineers to develop an API library to enable third-party integrations with our comparison shopping platform.

About Your Day-to-Day Responsibilities:

- Develop and maintain custom WP themes
- Develop content templates for WordPress using HTML and PHP (with some JS and CSS)
- Develop, extend, and maintain custom WordPress plugins
- Develop and maintain PHP libraries for our APIs
- Work to develop HTML, PHP, JS, and CSS best practices
- Work to develop best practices for the building, testing, and releasing of PHP code

About You:

- You have a deep understanding of PHP and the ability to ship high-quality, well-tested PHP code. Experience coding and releasing standalone PHP libraries is a plus, but it is not required.
- You love web technologies, especially PHP, HTML, CSS, and JS, and you know how they work intimately.
- You live and breathe WordPress themes and plugins. Experience writing code for other PHP frameworks is a plus, but it is not required.
- You are passionate about user experience, and your level of attention to things that impact UX shows it.
- You thrive in a collaborative environment, working directly with both engineering and non-engineering team members on a daily basis.
- You want to contribute to the WordPress community, whether in the form of releasing plugins, contributing to open-source plugins, or contributing to WordPress Core.

startup.name: WayBetter
startup.product_desc:
WayBetter is pioneering a new approach to behavior change. We call it The WayBetter Way™.

Our first product is DietBet, a game that motivates people to lose weight by betting on themselves. It works by providing group support, microgoals, and real rewards. And while there's money on the line, it isn't about betting. It’s about believing in yourself, investing in your health, and sticking to your commitments.

It works. Since 2013 dietbetters have lost over 2 million pounds. Along the way, we’ve paid out $10 million to winners.

Our Chief Scientist is at Brown Medical School and with her we're integrating evidence-based practices. We also work with top health and wellness influencers: Jillian Michaels, Chris Powell, Tim Ferriss, and many more.

The best part is that we succeed when our users do. We've been making money since the day we launched and we're growing and hiring. We just raised capital.

Stay tuned in 2016 for new products in smoking cessation, fitness, sleep, and more.

jobs.description:
As our Head of Product, you'll create products that help people adopt healthy habits.

Today our focus is on weight loss but over time (and with your leadership), we'll move into exercise, sleep, de-stressing, smoking cessation, etc.

Our ideal candidate is a composite superhero: a designer who obsesses over usability, clarity, and aesthetics; a technical manager who reliably ships quality code on time; an inventor; and a behavioral economist.

What makes you truly superhuman, however, is that you're human. You grok the daily battles we all fight with temptation. You get how hard it is to sustain the willpower to make true lifestyle changes. You like to laugh.

You're disappointed by wearables, not because of the technology itself but because it's boring. Tracking steps every day just isn't fun. Ditto for calorie-counting. We all know that technology can do more.

The way we see it, the solution isn't data. It's inspiration. It's about hauling yourself out of bed on a rainy morning to jog, or passing up the cupcakes someone just set down next to your desk. That's where the real battles are won (or lost).

You have a 7+ year track record of making engaging consumer apps from end to end (ideally games). 

You should have a technical background, even if your coding is rusty. 

You know how to wireframe and are familiar with the tools of the trade. 

You're extremely mobile savvy.

You should love interacting with customers.

You should have experience hiring and managing since you'll be building your own team from scratch (designers, product managers, developers).

Finally, you should have a passion for the science around habit modification, behavioral economics, game design, and fun theory.

We're gazing out the window and we just know you're out there. Superhero, write us at super@waybetter.com.

IMPORTANT! To apply, send us a note telling us (indeed, convincing us) why you're perfect for this job. We don't consider candidates without personalized cover letters.
jobs.title: Head of Product

startup.name: Digital Shadows
startup.product_desc:
Digital Shadows is a cyber threat intelligence company that protects organisations from data loss and targeted cyber attack. By applying our award-winning technology we enable organisations to exploit social, cloud and mobile technologies while keeping their security and reputations intact.

We have developed a vast monitoring system covering over 80 million information sources in 26 languages across the globe.  This includes social networking sites, blogs, forums, cyber criminal sites, chatrooms, search engines and file sharing sites.  We also monitor communication channels used by cyber criminals to plan their attacks as well as “dark web” sites frequented by hackers and organised criminals.  

Our monitoring service tells you what confidential, sensitive or proprietary data is leaking through the boundary.  We also monitor hostile groups and their operations to identify the who, what, where, when and how of a targeted attack.

jobs.description:
Our application covers 80 million sources of data in more than 26 languages, everything from Twitter, Facebook and LinkedIn to content hosted on the Tor network, IRC channels and insecure home devices.  We de-duplicate, enrich and analyse this data in near real time to produce a rich set of intelligence for our clients. Our market leading portal visualises and presents this intelligence.

All areas of the system are expanding in capability and complexity as the company grows and our development team is involved in the full software development lifecycle, from concept and design to implementation and testing.  Our agile development sprints produce substantial new functionality every 4 weeks and we have regular hack days which allow our developers to explore innovative ideas and technologies.

We are looking for a Java Developer with experience in building high-performance, scalable commercial applications. You will be a key member of a talented software development team and be primarily responsible for Java application development though the role will involve all aspects of product development and engineering and have scope to influence the product roadmap, technology choices, architecture and much more.

You will...

- Collaborate across teams to define, design, and ship new features
- Architect and design robust, scalable and secure software
- Write well structured, testable, efficient code
- Work with and integrate external tools, libraries, data sources and API’s
- Discover, evaluate, and implement new technologies
- Continually increase the quality of the application through bug fixing and other improvements
- Contribute in all phases of the software development lifecycle
- Contribute ideas and innovations to the product roadmap

Salary and equity will be negotiable depending on experience. We have just given a rough guide here.

For more information and to apply check our our full job advert here http://digital-shadows.workable.com/jobs/32292

jobs.description:
The Data Scientist will have the opportunity to research, design, and implement models that pull signal from a variety of data sets with varying attributes. The quality of data will vary from robust and broad to sparse and accurate. Alone these data sets have very little value, but when stitched together they act as a tuning fork that finds precision in a swarm of noise.

For the right candidate this is an exciting greenfield opportunity to apply both their professional experience and advanced education to solve complex problems in the mobile space. This candidate should have a history of working with disparate data sources to stitch together precise results in an academic or production environment.

Personality: 
+ Excited about the opportunity to define a new sector in the mobile space
+ Self driven, independent, creative and eager to learn new skills
+ Aren't happy with good, and build to great

Technical Requirements: 
+ PhD in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or related field
+ Direct experience with Machine Learning, Information Retrieval, Data Mining, Signal Processing, and Optimization
+ Proficiency in at least one scripting language, such as Ruby or Python
+ Expertise in Geographical Information Systems (GIS), Natural Language Processing (NLP), or Computational Advertising a plus
+ Experiences with large scale data processing (e.g. MapReduce) and information visualization a plus
+ 2+ years in a production environment a plus

Responsibilities: 
+ Build supervised and unsupervised learning systems to model online and offline user behavior
+ Drive feature engineering and experimentation to improve performance of our various algorithms
+ Collaborate on implementing and deploying data mining and analytics systems for large scale data sets
+ Build internal tools for monitoring and investigation purpose
+ Source, evaluate, and incorporate new data sets into the system to improve performance
+ Develop metrics and prototypes to drive business decisions
jobs.title: Data Scientist

startup.product_desc:
Originate, a pioneer in venture product development, partners with forward-looking enterprises and high-growth startups to design, build, and invest in ambitious software products and companies. jobs.description:
Originate is looking for a Head of Engineering to help build, guide and grow the best software team in Boston!  We invest and then build innovative web/mobile products in partnership with entrepreneurs and enterprises and we need a well-rounded software expert to be in charge of the growing team. 

Originate is a unique Venture firm.  We operate very similar to a VC in terms of deal flow, investment selection, etc, but instead of investing cash, we build software.  Working at Originate gives people the opportunity to have ownership in many new ventures and products (20% of the equity or profit that Originate receives is shared by everyone working on the project).  

We also help employees build their own side-projects and startups through our unique “20% Time” program: 

http://www.originate.com/stories/20-percent-time-done-right

We have offices in San Francisco, LA, NYC, Vegas, Boston, Sunnyvale, and Stockholm.  Originate is nearly 150 entrepreneurial-minded software engineers, designers, product specialist and business people and our growth is only limited by the number of incredible people we can add to the crew.  We are an engineering company at the core with tech stacks that are 70% Web (Scala, Node.JS, and RoR) and 30% Mobile (iOS, and Android).  If you can lead/grow a team of elite level engineers and still sling code yourself, we want to meet you!

Requirements:
5-10 years experience as a Software engineer with recent experience in at least one of our core technologies: Scala, Node.js, Rails, iOS, Android.  

Experience with functional programming and/or the following is a strong plus:  Haskell, Go, Clojure, Erlang

The ideal candidate has experience with enforcing best practices, tuning engineering process, TDD, code reviews, and CI.

Leadership experience should include building and leading a world-class team of engineers….  If you haven’t done this yet, but want to, apply!

BS or MS in CS, Computer Engineering, EE, or Math is strongly preferred.
jobs.title: Director of Engineering

startup.name: Feel Three
startup.product_desc:
The world is on the edge of another great revolution.

Virtual Reality, the next great computing platform, will finally arrive in 2015. Oculus (bought by Facebook in 2014 for $2b) are targeting a seated experience but currently available motion simulation chairs are very limited. You have a choice of paying £5-40k, or spending a few months, and several thousand pounds, building your own primitive DIY simulator. 

We designed a simpler solution that uses only three curved panels to form a spherical cockpit. An omni-directional drive chain hidden in the base allows movement in three axis simultaneously. People that actually feel like they're in a car or plane will find it much more convincing and enjoyable.

There are a dozen or so motion simulator producers but none are focused on VR and none are in our lower projected price range.

We will sell the base units quite affordably to bring customers into the platform then offer upgrades and addons for strong after sales.
startup.high_concept: Affordable, modular motion simulator for Virtual Reality

jobs.description:
We're interested in talking to people who love our project. VR is going to be huge and the first company that cracks the riddle of making a motion simulator affordable will be huge. That's going to be us, how about joining us?

We're looking for remote collaborators initially but we're seeking funding and about to apply to several hardware accelerators, so being willing to relocate when this happens could be required. 

We're looking for another enthusiastic team member, or two, who have skills in either hardware engineering, motion simulators, coding (arduino or Unity/UE4), marketing or design to help us take the project forward to manufacturing and Kickstarter. 

Drop us a message if you're interested and want to talk, just clicking the "I'm Interested" button doesn't really tell us you are... tell us why.
jobs.title: VR Motion Simulator Aficionado

jobs.description:
FabFitFun is looking for experienced Software Engineers to work in our West Hollywood office. You are obsessed with delivering the best possible customer experience, value creating clean, efficient, and well-tested code, and want to help architect the technical infrastructure for one of the world's fastest growing ecommerce and digital media companies.

RESPONSIBILITIES

Create, maintain, and lead the development of FabFitFun's e-commerce platform, including developing new user facing features for our incredibly engaged customer base.

Provide overall architecture guidance. Architect and implement data models and information flow between system components.

Design, implement, and maintain systems in payments (with an emphasis on recurring billing), marketing automation, logistics & inventory management, and customer service.

Architect, implement and manage a high-availability, secure and scalable server infrastructure.

Develop machine learning algorithms to analyze customer satisfaction and automate common tasks for efficient customer service.

Working with the entire team to provide a consistent, fast, and delightful, experience to our customers and partners

REQUIREMENTS

3+ years professional software engineering experience, including web-stack experience developing in multiple languages including Java or C/C++ and PHP, Node, Ruby, or Python. Experience in ecommerce is a plus.

A solid grounding in computer science, you understand the efficiency of the code you write in terms of time and space, and you put thought into your choice of algorithms, data structures, and db schemas. Meanwhile, you are pragmatic and know that its okay to sometimes build impermanent yet expedient solutions.

You take pride in your work and are excited to be part of delivering a delightful and joyful experience to hundreds of thousands of customers worldwide.

FULL APPLICATION:
http://fabfitfun.theresumator.com/apply/Nivnrm/Senior-Software-Engineer.html

startup.name: RJMetrics
startup.product_desc:
RJMetrics is an innovative and rapidly growing data analytics software company. Our mission is to inspire and empower data-driven people. We work with some of the fasting growing e-commerce, mobile, and software as a service businesses in the world and help them make smarter decisions with their data. We provide the kinds of deep insights that were formerly only accessible by large companies willing to invest in full-time data data scientists. 


Since our launch in early 2009, RJMetrics has grown to over 90 amazing team members, enlisted hundreds of customers, and raised over $20 million from some of the most successful technology investors in Philadelphia, New York, and Silicon Valley.

jobs.description:
Our product development team is composed of full-stack engineers with expertise in technologies like Clojure, AngularJS, PHP, Hadoop, and Java. We work in small teams, deploy dozens of times a day, and keep our projects short and focused. Engineers rotate between projects and areas of the product to learn and take on new challenges.

Here are a few examples of what we have built recently:

- Services that expose APIs for interacting with dynamic datasets
- A visualization tool on top of those APIs in AngularJS
- A system for detecting and modifying objects in a complex dependency graph

WHAT YOU'LL DO

As a Senior Web Applications Engineer you will help us design, build and operate web-based tools for managing, exploring, modeling and reporting on data. To be effective you’ll need to:

- Design, write and review browser-side and server-side code
- Drive best practices for web application architecture and implementation
- Work with the team to make sure our web applications are always available and snappy
- Recognize weaknesses in our technology and organization, and frequently tell us what we are doing wrong and why

WHAT YOU'LL NEED

To be successful in this role you will need to have opinions about how to build and operate web applications, and be eager to have an impact on the quality and speed of an entire team’s work. Candidates should have:

- Three years of experience building and running web applications
- Deep knowledge of javascript, and familiarity with the trade-offs of popular javascript frameworks
- Experience with at least one of the following: Clojure, PHP, Python, Ruby, Java
- Recent hands-on experience with SQL databases and caching systems like Memcache or Redis
- A track record of solving technical challenges and owning critical systems
- Knowledge of fundamental computer science concepts (even if they are not used every day)
jobs.title: Senior Web Applications Engineer

startup.name: Fenix International
startup.product_desc:
Fenix International delivers life-changing mobile enabled solar financing in partnership with MTN Group, Africa's largest Telecom (200M subscribers).

Over 1.3 billion people live without electricity in emerging markets and spend over $30Bn each year on fossil fuel to light and power their homes.  Fenix ReadyPay Solar enables customers to finance clean energy in micro-installments via a cell phone for less than their current energy costs.  Customers pay as little as $0.35 a day to finance solar panels, lights, radios, and even LCD TVs.  Fenix is also using big data from real time ReadyPay transactions to develop a next-generation Fenix Credit Score and provide greater access to capital for our customers and the 2.2 billion un-banked adults in emerging markets.  Fenix is funded by GDF Suez, Schneider Electric, Orange France Telecom and individual investors including Tom Dinwoodie, co-founder of SunPower.
startup.high_concept: Solar power unlocked by mobile payments at just $0.35 cents per day

jobs.description:
Fenix International is looking for a talented self-starting software engineer to join the Fenix team and scale ReadyPay.

ReadyPay is Fenix's financial platform that allows customers to pay-to-own Fenix's solar systems over time. ReadyPay enables customers to make payments from a mobile phone and receive a secure code to unlock access to solar power. Launched in Uganda in partnership with MTN, ReadyPay is available now for as little $0.39 per day.

This position offers a great opportunity to work alongside an elite team of engineers and professionals and contribute to the success of a fast-moving startup with great potential for social impact. This position offers a unique opportunity for interesting global travel to Sub-Saharan Africa (~10% time).


Key Responsibilities

-Administer cloud based Linux servers and spearhead web application development
-Collaborate with design team on software development for future product offerings
-Create support applications (Mac, PC, Android, iOS) for current and future products
-Participate in new product development from concept to production and beyond
 

Required Skills & Experience

-Bachelors or Masters in a relevant engineering discipline (Computer Engineering, Software Engineering, Computer Science preferred)
-Programming language proficiency in Python
-Experience creating and maintaining scalable web applications
-Appreciation for detailed source code documentation and organized code structuring
-Ability to generate testable software requirements and implement per requirements
-Working knowledge of both high-level object oriented and low-level procedural programming concepts. A full-stack developer.
-Comfort architecting software per modern software design patterns (MVP, MVC, etc)
-Excellent written and verbal communication skills in English 

Desired Skills

-Experience with the Django web framework
-Frontend web programming experience (JavaScript, HTML, CSS) 
-Database administration and data management skills (SQL)

startup.name: SimplePrints
startup.product_desc:
Our mission at Simple + Co is to make it effortless to turn captured experiences into beautiful stories that we can share or keep for ourselves. We are experts at building mobile experiences and our apps have been recognized by The New York Times, USA Today, SXSW, and Apple as best in class. 

The iPhone has democratized photography by enabling us to take thousands of professional-quality photos and have access to all of them from the convenience of our pockets. Many of these photos are parts of wonderful stories, but they are lost on our devices or in the cloud. 

Facebook and Instagram have made it easy to publicly share these photos right when they are taken, however, we are still lacking a way to turn captured experiences into coherent and meaningful stories. 

Our first product, SimplePrints, makes it effortless and fun to turn photos into meaningful stories that can be shared, gifted, or archived.
startup.high_concept: The Easiest Photo Book You've Ever Made

jobs.description:

Our company has appeared in the New York Times, USA Today, Techcrunch, and our apps have been featured by Apple and recognized at SXSW. We are backed by 500 Startups, angel investors, and great advisors such as Dave Bagshaw (former CEO of Shutterfly), Gentry Underwood (founder of Mailbox) and Semyon Dukach (founder of SMTP).

We are currently focused on growing SimplePrints, the easiest way to create a photo book from your mobile phone. Over the past 12 months Simpleprints has grown to 1M users and generates over $4M in annual revenue.

Currently we have a team of 4 in Mountain View with an office in Vietnam.

Background on Founders:
Matt Sullivan: Co-founder, Designer and CEO 
Graduated from Stanford with a Masters in Design and taught courses at the Stanford Institute of Design (d.school). Previously he founded two companies and was a designer at IDEO. Matt is originally from Hawaii and likes to kitesurf and rock climb.

Alexandre Oliveira: Co-founder, Product and CTO 
Graduated from MIT with an Undergrad and Masters in Computer Science and worked at Google and Microsoft. Alex is originally from Portugal and likes to learn new languages in his free time.

Your role in the company:
